de.gbv.beacon
Class BeaconParser

java.lang.Object
  de.gbv.beacon.BeaconParser
Direct Known Subclasses:
BeaconTextParser, BeaconXMLParser
public abstract class BeaconParser
extends Object

Basic interface for Beacon parsers. Implementations of this abstract class parse serialized Beacon dumps. A parser is bound to a BeaconHandler or to a BeaconProcessor which process successfully parsed meta fields and links. Applications should also register a ErrorHandler before starting to parse.

Author:
Jakob Voss
See Also:
BeaconTextParser, BeaconXMLParser

parse

public void parse(Reader source,
                  String systemID)
           throws IOException,
                  BeaconException
Parse a serialized Beacon dump. Unrecoverable errors will throw an excpetion. Recoverable errors and warnings will be notified to the registered ErrorHandler, which may choose to throw an exception to stop parsing.

Throws:
IOException
BeaconException

setErrorHandler

public void setErrorHandler(ErrorHandler handler)
Register an error event handler. If the application does not register an error handler (also by setting the handler to null) an instance of DefaultErrorHandler is used.

Parameters:
handler - The error handler or null.

getErrorHandler

public ErrorHandler getErrorHandler()
Return the current error handler.

Returns:
The current error handler
